tr.td: The subject of the certificate. This is only available performing a check on an HTTPS server.
The absolute timestamp in seconds for the certificate expiration. This is only available performing a check on an HTTPS server.
The absolute timestamp of the issue of the certificate. This is only available performing a check on an HTTPS server.
A string describing a certificate error in our validation. This is only available performing a check on an HTTPS server.
The number of bytes that the result was truncated.
The number of bytes returned from a response payload.
The relative timestamp in seconds til certification expiration. This is only available performing a check on an HTTPS server.
The time to connect measured in milliseconds.
The time took to finish executing the check in milliseconds.

The string representing a single body_matches value specified in a remote.http check. This metrics are only present when using a body_matches option. one is the actual key you have specified for the body_matches option.
The time to first byte measured in milliseconds.

The string representing a single body_matches value specified in a remote.http check. This metrics are only present when using a body_matches option. two is the actual key you have specified for the body_matches option.
The string representing the body match specified in a remote.http check.
The issue string for the certificate. This is only available performing a check on an HTTPS server.
